title.narrative: Effective and Inclusive implementation of Peace Agreement,2015

description.narrative: This project is intending to improve public interest issues advocacy and lobby engagement at the National level. The advocacy and lobby will covers issues associated with peace agreement, Aug.2015 matters centred on effective and timely implementation of the peace agreement provisions. Among the key peace agreement provisions are; institutional and legislations reforms, observation of permanent ceasefire, justice and accountability, national reconciliation and healing security sector reform and economic reforms. The advocacy and lobby will target the central government level targeting the national parliament, independent commissions and executive ministries. This project will be focusing on conducting advocacy and lobby for the effective and timely implementation of the signed peace agreement between the government and the SPLM-IO. The advocacy and lobby for the effective and timely implementation of the peace agreement is approached in two components as follow; Component 1: Sensitization of the communities on the peace agreement This component is aiming at disseminating the peace agreement to the members of the communities. The dissemination methods will be radio talk shows, public dialogues, and public lecture. Component 2: Monitoring and reporting on the implementation of the peace agreement This component is aiming at creating pressure for the parties to the peace agreement for effective and timely implementation of the agreement. This component will be implemented through round tables, radio talk shows, public debates, diplomatic lobby and press engagement. The purpose of designing the project in this manner was due to the experiences learned from the Comprehensive Peace Agreement-CPA, 2015 implementation history. The CPA implementation process was much of the parties to the agreement responsibility. This resulted for them to ineffectively and timely implement the CPA, 2015. Evidences were the failure of the parties to CPA implementation decisively reject to commit themselves for realization of national reconciliation and protocol on Abyei. Therefore this project will be public interest advocacy for the effectively and timely implementation of the South Sudan peace Agreement, 2015. The direct beneficiaries of this project will be civil society and the indirect beneficiaries will the communities and state institutions namely national parliament, national peace and reconciliation commission, Truth, Healing and Reconciliation commission and others.
